intro: Macromiscus brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian star moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has a distinctive appearance with a dense, cushion-like growth form composed of tiny, closely packed leaves. Its structure consists of a thallus with a central stalk and lateral branches, which are covered in a layer of rhizoids. Macromiscus brasiliensis plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
